content: I completely agree with you. in many cultures, the elderly are often revered for their wisdom and life experience. however, in modern societies, the focus is often on valuing productivity, youth, and physical appearance. by dismissing the elderly as "old and useless," we are ignoring the vast knowledge and insights that they can offer based on their years of experience. it's essential for society to shift its focus from youth and productivity to valuing the contributions and experiences of the elderly. doing so can promote intergenerational understanding and lead to a greater appreciation for the value of life experience. it can also lead to a more compassionate and understanding approach to end-of-life care and a recognition that aging and dying are natural parts of life.
